info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 12:46AM EDT until March 31 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Baldwin County in southwestern Alabama... Escambia County in south central Alabama... Southwestern Conecuh County in south central Alabama... Santa Rosa County in northwestern Florida... Northwestern Escambia County in northwestern Florida... * Until 1230 AM CDT. * At 1145 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of McCullough to 5 miles southwest of Atmore to 3 miles east of Loxley, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Atmore, Brewton, Century, Flomaton, Loxley, McCullough, Stapleton, East Brewton, Molino, Castleberry, Jay, Pollard, Riverview, Bratt, I65 And CR 1, Point Baker, I65 And AL 113, I65 And AL 21 and Poarch Creek Reservation. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for south central and southwestern Alabama...and northwestern Florida.
